title: BrandLogic in the news
body: <p><a href="http://www.brandlogic.com" title="Seamless Branding">BrandLogic</a> won an award for the new <a href="http://new.stjohns.edu/" title="St. John's University">SJU site</a> recently.  It showed up on <a href="http://news.search.yahoo.com/news/search?p=brandlogic" title="Yahoo! News!">Yahoo News</a> (<a href="http://search.news.yahoo.com/usns/ynsearch/categories/47/index.html?p=brandlogic" title="Yahoo! News! RSS! feed!">RSS</a>) and <a href="http://news.google.com/news?scoring=d&amp;q=brandlogic" title="yay google news">Google News</a> (<a href="http://www.voidstar.com/gnews2rss.php?num=15&amp;q=brandlogic" title="unofficial google news feed">RSS</a>).  Of all the sites that I've worked on in the past 5 years, I think that SJU's site turned out the best.  Not to mention its <a href="http://validator.w3.org/" title="XHTML1.1 that is">XHTML</a> and <a href="http://jigsaw.w3.org/css-validator/" title="CSS2.1 to be exact">CSS</a> validity.  Well mostly valid.  There are still many pieces of content which aren't, and the damn ASP.Net Calendar control, and probably a few pieces of our own code that squeaked through unnoticed.</p>
